div1.p: Leikind is seeking information on Reed for a paper he is to present and recollects that Hench was interested in the subject.

div1.head: Letter from Morris C. Leikind to Jim [s.n.], September 8, 1951
div1.p:
I am in need of certain information which I hope you might
help me to obtain.

I have a recollection that Dr. Philip Hench has been interested
for some time in Walter Reed. However I don't recall any publications
by Hench on this subject. H Is he by chance writing a book on Reed?
I have never met Hench personally so I thought you might be able to
get some info for me. The reason I am interested is that I have to
read a paper on Oct. 23 on Walter Reed. It is in connection with the
centennial of Reed's birth which falls on Sept. 21 13. The group
I am to address however has its first fall meeting on Oct. 23, hence
the delay in the date. In any case, if Hench has any reprints of his
papers on the subject I would appreciate having them. Also the loan of
some lantern slides if available. We do have quite a bit of pictorial
stuff here of course, but I thought that Hench may have some pictures
which we don't have.

Please let me know as soon as you can about anything you can
find out. Address your letter together with any stuff you can send
as below:
Morris C. Leikind
Chief, Division of Historical Research
Medical Museum
Armed Forces Institute of Pathology
7th and Independence, S.W.
Washington 25, D.C.
